reviewText: I got this game today (free) so decided to write a review after playing it a little. - okay, for just a few minutes but I value my sanity! You control a cute and colorful penguin who basically has to escape from a test laboratory by jumping over lethal obstacles to progross from level to level. Graphically, the game is colorful with some nice lighting but you won't get a chance to look for long before your first death! You collect yellow orbs in each level with the aim to escape by completing 24 levels. In the background is some manical music which will drive you crazy!\n\nThere really isn't much more to say about the game. It offers partial control but after a few minutes it becomes dull and repetitive. There are much better and cheaper games in the same catergory as this and the game is just too dated and simplistic to play for more than a few minutes. Thumbs down from me guys :(
voteText: 41 of 52 people (79%) found this review helpful 3 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Way, way too hard. The jumps are almost impossible to time. The perspective turns in unexpected ways and at unexpected points in the level. The effects get in your way sometimes.

I couldn't even make it past level five or so. If the first couple levels (or chapters) were easier, I could see myself enjoying this somewhat, but until then, it's just not something I would want others to play.

Pros:
Not much, to be honest.
Cons:
Way, way too hard
Nearly impossible to time your jumps
Perspective changes in weird ways, unexpectedly

reviewText:
Tried this game because it looks hillarious, but it is really just a rage game, and all of its difficulty comes from how poorly designed this game really is.

Pros:
-a funny pink penguin
-hillariously inaccurate blood splatter effect upon death
- if you stick with it, some levels have a 2D silhouette art style that is much more appealing than the bad 3D that is present in a majority of the game.

Cons:
-entire game is based around percise jumps where you will die if you jump a single pixel too soon or late.
-frequent camera changes become confusing especially when paired with confusing 3D level design.
-screeching deatth sound effect
-very bare bones minimalist mechanics and graphics

In short, if you are curious about this game grab it for free. I would not recomend spending more than 50 cents on this.

reviewText:
If I wanted to play a poorly designed level that kills you for no reason, I'd go back to playing expert mode on Super Mario Maker.

Pros
-See Cons

Cons
-The camera is usually at a bad angle to tell where holes or harmful objects are
-The camera changes at the worst posible times which kills you
-Some levels start off by killing you if you don't jump immediately
-You need to get every single jump perfect or you have to start over

reviewText: I got this game for $.78 when i was on sale, but even for $1 you don't lose much checking it out.  I personally didnt enjoy the game (hence the low play time).  I found the jump arc far too short to have much fun, as you had to get right next to (basically until there was clipping between the player model and the obstacle) the obstacle before you jumped.  There was no variable jump, either.  Idunno,  this game didnt appeal to me, but it's also not the type of game I typically play.  You dont lose much by checking it out, so if you're on the edge, just go ahead and buy it.
